values: Take a look at the headlines from yesterday's and today's Times... Now am I the only one who can see an obvious solution here?

If you enter a pub and they sell this... I urge you to order yourself a nice cool bottle. Repeat this tenfold then fall over in the direction of down. Simmer for eight hours in a child's bed, turning regularly to avoid sticking to the rubber sheet. Remove from bed, contemplate the immeasurable pain of the ice cold, apple flavoured scaffold pole that appears to be lodged between your skull and frontal lobe and add two pints of water. Reactivate the now, stale alcohol and drive for three hours until spent.

Just when you think life's a bunch of arse it flips up on you and you realise it's not so bad after all.
I have to go to that there London this afto for a meeting then stay over for another one tomorrow all very tedious until I told one of my mates who said, "I'm in London tonight, playing at the Electric Proms, come down!"
This knocked on to another friend of mine who's invited me along tomorrow!
So brilliantly tonight I'm going to see Weller and The Magic Numbers then tomorrow The Good The Bad & The Queen, Paul Simonon, Simon Tong and Damon Alban's new band.

http://www.thegoodthebadandthequeen.com/index.php

Smart!

I worked with a bloke once at the BBC, he was Terry Wogan's radio show producer. He was one of those people it was impossible to be miserable around, a real happy go lucky bloke who never got stressed about anything and always had words of encouragement and advice for a young assistant producer as I was then. He refused to take his job anymore seriously than was needed, his line was always, "Don't worry about it Laurence, it's not as if we're saving lives is it?"

In saying this he was one of the most professional, intelligent and inspirational people I'd ever worked with, the people I truly admire in this business are very few and far between but Paul Walters was one of them.

Sadly he passed away on Friday at the young age of 59. Life really is a bugger sometimes.

Doing some research for a golf programme format based loosley around Tin Cup and I found this.
This really made me laugh because it's what I do every morning...

I found this mildly amusing... for a Friday...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CyZw5_RM1W0

So I had a few bevvies in Norwich on Saturday but had to stop as I was picking up my nan from the station to take her to dinner.
We drove to The Last Wine Bar, where we were eating but there was nowhere to park so we drove up to The Playhouse. I was just getting Nanna unbuckled when two pissed up idiots approached the car, dropped their trousers and pressed there tallywhackers up against the window.
Nanna nearly had a stroke, the mental kind not an actully stroke like you'd stroke a dog - although she might have liked to. Anyway, I gave chase but the gangly inebriates got away...

Nanna remains stable....

Maybe you're expecting one of those posts which contradicts the subject header, perhaps one that elaborates on how easy things are? Well this isn't it.

Life, it's bloody hard sometimes isn't it? And what do you get for that summation? Someone telling you there are lots of people worse off than you. Yes there are, so now you feel guilty as well as desperate.

Still, it would be wrong to drive to the back of the University Campus in your van and run a length of hosepipe through the front window - that would be like giving up... sweet giving up...mmmmmmmm...

My nephew Jack and his young lady Louise had a little girl yesterday. I am now a Great Uncle and the poor, innocent child has an Uncle Barry...

Suffer little children indeed...

I may be in minority here but I'm not enjoying Extras that much. I find it a bit, well predictable...
Every guest star they have plays the same character, self obsessed, insecure... and in every word they say you can hear Steven Merchant and Ricky Gervais. This worked very well with The Office and even the first series but because of their popularity and the podcasts, the style of writing has become just too, too familiar. There are still genius moments, Ronnie Corbett and David Bowie - but it's just become roundly unbelievable. The Office and Extras series one worked because their wasn't one thing that happened that you wouldn't expect to happen in real life. This series fails because;

Andy wouldn't have kept the same agent once he was a success.
He wouldn't hang around with with the Scotch bint as much.
Chris Martin would not of appeared in When the Whistle Blows.
Moira Stewert would not be frisked for chang at the entrance of the BAFTAS.

Maybe I'm being hypercritical but I'm a child of the seventies damn you! I grew up on a diet of Monty Python, The Goodies, Not the 9 O'clock News, The Young Ones, Comic Strip, Harry Enfield,The Fast Show, Fist of Fun, TMWRNJ, and The Mighty Boosh. I may have high standards but it's their fault... They made me what I am!!!!!

So wise up Gervais - it's not working anymore...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=eSYKdelFHiQ

I love the way this dude tries to carry on even though he's clearly half knocked himself out...

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2B8IDuws7Vk

Why would you let someone do this to you

So having had some dullard hang up on me after I tied her knots over what she actually knew to be fact, what she presumed to be so and what was a blatant guess (I asked if they'd received a fax - a tricky question that could confuse a stupid person) I decided I'd get no joy from Customer Service relating to my 'lost' cheque. After delving around on the net for a bit I found the name of the head honcho of customer service and a load of different fax numbers for various offices. I dialled these numbers from my phone and changed the last number each time until someone answered. I then explained I was calling from the Inland Revenue in Newcastle and needed to send an urgent fax document for signing to Richard Smithers (head honcho bloke). After a bit of lying from me about his secretary giving me the wrong number - the girl on the phone gave me his direct phone and fax. I sent through a long letter documenting what had happened and all the inconvenience I'd had to go to to correct what was essentially, their mistake. I also told of the incompetence of his customer service staff whose answer to difficult queries tends to be one of three things, say 'It's not my problem.', put you on hold until you die or put the phone down.
About two hours later I received a call from Smithers who was so apologetic it was embarrassing. He said he'd spoken to each of the people who had dealt with me and reprimanded them about their handling of the situation. He said an apology would be written and sent to me. He then added that the cheque had now miraculously appeared on their system and he could now refund the overpayment. I thanked him for his diligence and then said I was giving him a months notice that I would be ending my contract with O2. He actually asked me why. I explained;

"I only have one phone, I use it all the time for work, I pay my bills on time every month, I was cut off with no prior warning (which incidentally is against the law) for not paying a bill that I had actually paid. When I tried to sort it out, I was treated so shabbily by people of such limited knowledge, if I had your job (Smithers') I would hang my head in abject shame. I've wasted the past two days, phoning my bank and trying track down the 'lost' cheque with absolutely no indication that anyone from O2 was doing anything about it. I then had to resort to using my contacts to get the head of departments number to finally get some response. You're lucky I'm not billing you for my time."

To be fair, he agreed with me but was curious to know where I got his number. I left him hanging and just said I'd work in consumer affairs within the media for 15 years and I can pretty much get anyone's number. 

I'll be changing my number soon so I'll let you all know, I might just keep the number and go pay as you go. In the meantime, if you're with O2 and have any trouble with their customer services, give Richard Smithers a call his direct number is  0845 3300684

So last night my phone was barred by the fascist mobile technology overlords O2 due to an unpaid bill. I had to pay on my card to get reconnected and then when I come into work today and check the internet it turns out the cheque was cashed on the 19th September. So I phone them and they say they need proof of who cashed it! Now, you would have thought the mere fact that I have a statement that says a cheque was cashed for exactly the same amount as I supposedly am overdue was coincidence enough for them to look into it. However, it's me that has to phone my bank and go through another load of security bollocks that ends up in the snot nose, flu ridden knob jockey telling me he can't fax anything, he has to post it because I don't have a four digit telephone banking code but I do know my address, postcode, date of birth and mother's fucking maiden name and let's face it - anyone could know that! 

I know that we need to have these amoebas in our society to do these menial jobs but fuck me - you really have to be at the bottom of the foodchain with a mouth and arse in the same place to work in a fucking call centre. These people are so devoid of common sense it's a wonder they can function as a human being - the worse thing is they actually think they're providing a service? 

I know you'll probably say that Direct Debit is better but it's just another way for these big companies to automate your life so it makes it even harder to break ties with them... JESUS!!!

At last we've moved in... we're stuck in the middle of nowhere but at least there's a Homebase, Pets at Home and a McDonalds nearby...



We also have new computers with bigger screens and big leather chairs whoo hoo!

No not the much maligned 70's comedy starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckensdale and Fulton MacKay. I mean this porridge...



The much maligned breakfast of the Scotch, that evokes memories of a mush in a skirt and vest about to throw a steel ball off the box of aforementioned foodstuff and onto the breakfast table of my youth. 
Anyway, I've started eating it again in the mornings because Gillian McKeith (You Are What You Eat) says it's a slow release energy food and as I'm now running every morning as well as cycling to work - I need as much of that as I can get! Incidently, you would have thought that all the cycling I do would stand me in good stead for running... not so - different muscle groups apparently... well not apparently it's true I was fucked after a mile! Anyway, where was I? Oh yes porridge.

I hadn't made it for a while so  I put some oats in a saucepan and added some milk (no water for this soldier) oops! Too much milk better add some more oats... Mmmm getting warm now starting to thicken... bugger! Too thick! Add more milk... shit! Looks like monkey spunk... Add more oats!... and on it went until I had a massive saucepan full of lumpy porridge that Bazroy would have been hard put to finish (not really). So waste not want not - I added some honey (thanks Gillian) and ate the lot.

More energy my hairy ringpiece! I feel like I've eaten 5 christmas dinners and need a sleep on the couch in front of Chitty Chitty Bang Bang.

If I can't get the oats/milk ratio sorted tomorrow it's back to bacon sarnies - fuck McKeith! 

Something occured to me while watching YAWYE... 

At what point do the punters on that show think inviting a mental, Scotch, dwarf around to their house to sift through their poo on national television is any less degrading than being a bit fat or having bad eating habits?

I had to do a recce yesterday for some filming and the director and I stumbled across a massive disused factory, Ming, you're a local boy - you'll probably know it - The Eastern Electricity Building on Duke Street. 
It's a Goliath of a structure built just after the war from bomb proof concrete. This causes a slight problem because they can't sell the bastard and turn it into flats (to solid to renovate or change) and they can't demolish the fucker because it's right by the river and would cost too much money. This is a good thing because it just sits there, like a wealthy old relative who refuses too die or degenerate and these days only plays host to the odd art exhibition.
Anyway, some arty fucker last year took it upon himself to write a book. So what I hear you say, well this I say.
He wrote it on the building. Meticulously stringing every sentence, not in blocks but in level lines all the way around. 
Thought you might like to see some pictures... so here you are.

Hello, I'm a messenger from God and he told me to 
tell you to give all your money to Lozzaman. 
Do it now or I'll tell God you've been wanking at 
work again.

It's Friday and to celebrate me taking a trip to the zoo and flimsily disguising it as a recce for a shoot, I thought I'd set a competition. The winner will receive a bag with a book in it that was given to me free at the Benicassim Music Festival this year. The book is a bit like that arty Wallpaper magazine but it's all in foreign, you'll all love it.
All you have to do is come up with a caption for the following Panda related picture.



If of course you can be arsed... It the short time it's taken me to write this entry my enthusiasm for the project has gone...
I'm going to audition for the Micheal Knight role...

On the subject of LOST, I found this site which generates random theories, not spoilers.

It's quite fun to keep refreshing the page and taking in all the possible things that could be happening, then your brain turns to uncooked dough and you slowly zone out into a pool of drool on your desk... aaaaaah

Try it here!

Dough, wings, cheese & Tennants

You'll recall our hero had just watched Liverpool beat West Ham and was very tired from the night before. We all were, and of course the wise thing to do would be to go home and have a little sleep before the dreaded 8.6 challenge. So we decided to go to Pizza Hut and eat stodgy shite food and drink beer. Everyone was very irritable and cross and we bickered about everything... very amusing. We were joined by Kombe and Bobs but by this time I was treading water and just wanted to go home. I dropped Barry off and explained I wouldn't be coming out - he asked for a lift round to Tom's so I took him round before going home.
Hang on! Bollocks I thought - it's only one night and you're only tired. I turned around, got changed and went back to Tom's. It was in full swing, if full swing is sitting around drinking Tenants Super out of a can... Bazroy had drunk 5 cans of the foul fluid but I'm sure he'll tell you about that and the resulting behaviour...

I decided I couldn't go on after I recieved a text from the girl I'd met the night before asking me to come over. I went home and waited for her to pick me up. I did have a horrible moment of night terrors and woke up in a cold sweat not knowing where I was but I soon drifted off into a blissful sleep.

Cunterbury Tales

Woke up to a steaming cup of coffee and a plate full of marmite on toast... I could get quite attached to this girl! She dropped me off to get changed for we were off to Canterbury for a day of cider with the Ashford Javes. Bazroy's lovely young lady dropped us at the station and we started the onslaught of apple juice attack.
Some highlights included;
Batty leaving a pub through the window.
Standing in a gay bar chanting gay, gay, gay to everyone who came through the door.
Eating 3 pieces of chicken, a bucket of chips, a Big Mac and a double cheeseburger
Batty buying a pith helmet from a street vendor then demanding his money back because it was fucked
Singing Layla to Dominominominic
Lots of taking the piss on the train on the way home.

We arrived back in Ashford and Bazroy went off with his young lady and mine was there to meet me in a pimped up Pug 104 with 17" rims and blacked out windows. Sounded like a Dresden bomber from the inside. I was pretty well shickered by this time so we went to Bar Three Zero. Funniest moment of the night was Steve Holden, who couldn't get in because he was wearing shorts, went to a charity bin at the back of the library and obtained a pair of blue peg trousers to wear.
My girlie and I left at that point but there was more drinking to be done... We went to The Ferry in Appledore where she works to see all of her friends (gulp!). I placated them all by beating them at pool despite my pissed state and finally we went home.
Had a chat with her Dad who said, I swear, "Night you kids, see you in the morning." and we went to bed. The usual fair, tossing and turning in a single bed - hot sticky cider headache - woke up needed a piss. Went to the bathroom without turning the light on, lest I disturbed her Dad and stepped in something soft, and a bit wet.
Turned the light on and the fucking cat had killed a wood pigeon and chucked bits of it all over the bathroom. I fucking screamed!
Next morning we woke to the sounds of a wood pigeon and she said, "Coo coo, where's my husband?" which made me laugh because I was thinking the same thing.
She gave me a lift to Ashford and I made my way back to Norwich. Get on really well with her but is there a future with a 15 year age gap? Who knows, who cares? Enjoy it while it's there I say! Never did Peter Stringfellow any harm...!
What a random picture from the China Daily news. A panda reunion apparently...

So given that Bazroy99 ended my football career, I thought I'd take up golf. I've been having lessons which involves practising on something called an Explanar TM. Big frame with weighted rollers that encourages muscle memory to promote the perfect swing.

You feel a bit of a dick at first but it does actually work. It's actaually more fun than the golf because it makes a sound like a lightsabre and because of the shape it's in surround sound.
Then I had to be measured for fitted clubs which involves measuring the distance from your fingertip to the floor, the width of your hand, your wrist to the floor and the length of you longest finger. Once this is done, you get taken out to the driving range and told to 'lock your wrist' or 'realign your back foot' all very technical but very useful. And here's the thing, I've played golf before and I'm okay but now I've had a few lessons and do things correctly I'm actually pretty good.
So who needs football? Golf is now my mistress!

Other news;
The totty count in the office is up
I'm seeing a girl
I'm top of our mini league Dream Team
I'm very excited about Rocky 6
I ate some out of date salsa and nearly shat myself inside out.

I hope I'm here tomorrow to tell the tale.

Farewell my gracious friends...

I'm sure there's a market for this untapped creativity... oh yeah - it's this website isn't it... doh!
I've really hit the wall this week. I just can't be bothered to do anything least of all write in this fucking cunt's mouth of a journal...

So you know those comments you sometimes make, off handed comments that people take in then bring up at a later date and you have no choice but to go along with it. Well I appear to have gotten myself into a bit of a fix.

A girl at work mentioned a couple of weeks ago that her Mum's horse had gone to Horse Bordstall...
"Oh I love horses." I said
"Do you ride?"
"Yes..." I said.

About a week later the same girl came up top me and in front of the whole office said,
"Laurence, you said you liked riding didn't you?"
"Um..."
"Well Tully's back from hoofcamp and Mum needs someone to excercise him because his a bit strong for her, would you like to do it?"
"Er... wha... yeah."

Now I rode a bit in my early twentys, I even had a part riding share of a horse and I was an okay rider. But to say I was a little rusty would be as grosser understatement as the Titanic is a bit leaky.



I met Tully last night, a fucking huge bastard... 17 hands of solid muscle - as I approached he tossed his head and laughed at me. It was like WWF, he pointed his hoof and called me out. 
I have romantic visions of me riding through the Norfolk countryside like the mush in Shadow of the Collossus but I think I might just end up in traction.


A big horse yesterday...

My first session is next Thursday... I'll report back then.

So I know this is a subject we keep returning to but I have to vent my cunting spleen somewhere! It's very hot in our office today, I feel I'm working for the foreign office in Belize in 1956. That may be the reason for my shorter fuse today who knows, who cares? The situation is being made worse by my work mate, lovely bloke and I usually get on with him but for some reason this week he keeps saying two phrases over and over again for, as far as I can gather - no apparent reason. I don't know if it's because he turned 40 this week but again, who knows, who cares?
When I say anything that requires a response to the affirmative he says 'innit'.

"It's fucking hot in here today."
"innit!"
"That James Morrison album is good."
"Innit!"

You get the picture.

The other annoying saying has no rhyme or reason. Every so often he'll stop what he's doing, turn to face me and say,

"It's all over the front page."

After hearing him repeat this 24 times today I fear the contents of his crushed skull may be "all over the front desk" because, dear reader - I will bludgeon him to death with the fucking fax machine.

So my friends, I'm off to a small coastal town in Spain for a few days where El Cid had a fight with some people once. It's called Peniscola and is ver ver nice...



After a couple of days chillin' I'm going to The Benicasim music festival where my mates are headlining the main stage on Sunday. I'll have an update for you next week with lots of pictures. 



Take care bitches!

Sorry about these random postings but the strangest things keep happening - or I keep doing the strangest things... I'm working on a documentary at the moment uncovering the secret sex lives of Britains, dogging, swinging etc. and today I have been mostly looking at swinging web sites and clubs. Apart form not being able to stand up for most of the day (curse these baggy cargo shorts) I have also been subjected to the most low rent, shambolic sites imaginable. Check out this site for instance - it's not particularly smutty or dirty but please take a minute to check out the Thailand location pictures, then the Newcastle location pictures - remember this is supposedly the same chain of clubs...

Visit Club 2000 here


I love my job! I love my job! I love my job yep yep I love my job!

So, a good start to the day... had my contract extended for a year, got a change of line manager and a pay rise!

Also had to try to contact Jarvis Cocker for work and found his myspace http://myspace.com/jarvspace with the brilliant song "The Cunts are Still Running the World". Dropped him a line and when I got into work this morning - I had a message from him on my phone!!!
All in all a good start to a Wednesday.
